questions.title: Narrative Essay Structure
questions.question: What is the structure of a Narrative Essay?
paragraphs: PARAGRAPH 1 - INTRODUCTION: • Start with: "Everyone would have..." (universal hook) • Then say: "I remember..." (introduce the experience) • Hint at what you learned
PARAGRAPH 2 - CONTEXT: • Start with: "It was..." or "It happened..." • Tell the TIME (when it happened) • Tell the PLACE (where it happened) • Introduce the characters involved

PARAGRAPH 3 - CHAIN OF EVENTS: • Tell what happened in order (beginning → middle) • Include: "The catch was..." (turning point/conflict) • This is where the problem or twist comes • Build tension and suspense
PARAGRAPH 4 - CHANGE & RESOLUTION: • Tell how the problem was solved • Describe what changed • How did the story end? • What was the result?

PARAGRAPH 5 - CONCLUSION: • Start with: "This experience taught me..." or "That day taught me..." • Include: "I learned that..." (lesson) • End with: "I will always..." or "I will never..." or "I won't..."

questions.title: Key Phrases to Remember
questions.question: What are the key phrases to use in a Narrative Essay?
paragraphs: OPENING HOOKS (Paragraph 1): • Everyone would have experienced... • Everyone would have faced... • Everyone would have had... • Everyone would have witnessed...
INTRODUCING THE EXPERIENCE (Paragraph 1): • I remember a time when... • I remember the day when... • I will never forget the day... • One such incident happened to me...
CONTEXT PHRASES (Paragraph 2): • It was a [day] in [month]... • It happened on a [day] morning/evening... • It was during the [season/holiday]... • The incident took place at...
TURNING POINT (Paragraph 3): • The catch was that... • The problem was that... • That's when things went wrong... • Suddenly... • To my surprise...
CONCLUSION PHRASES (Paragraph 5): • This experience taught me that... • That day taught me that... • I learned that... • I will always... • I will never... • I won't...

questions.title: Narrative vs Descriptive Essay
questions.question: What is the difference between Narrative and Descriptive Essay?
paragraphs: NARRATIVE ESSAY: • Tells a story of what HAPPENED • Dynamic - like a movie • Has a PLOT with beginning, middle, end • Includes a CONFLICT or PROBLEM • Has a RESOLUTION (how it ended) • Events are in TIME ORDER (chronological) • Example topics: A Day When..., When I..., A Time I...

DESCRIPTIVE ESSAY: • Describes what something IS LIKE • Static - like a photograph • Uses sensory details (see, hear, smell, feel) • Focuses on appearance, qualities, characteristics • No plot or conflict needed • Example topics: My Best Friend, My School, My Hometown
